source.dffcf9d6:
import pandas as pd
house_file_path = '../input/train.csv'
data = pd.read_csv(house_file_path)
y = data.SalePrice
house_price_predictors = ['LotArea','YearBuilt','1stFlrSF','2ndFlrSF','FullBath','BedroomAbvGr','TotRmsAbvGrd']
X = data[house_price_predictors]
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
house_model = DecisionTreeRegressor()
house_model.fit(X,y)
print("Making prediction for the following 5 houses:")
print(X.head())
print("The predictions are")
print(house_model.predict(X.head()))
source.58e2adbc:
import pandas as pd
house_file_path = '../input/train.csv'
data = pd.read_csv(house_file_path)
y = data.SalePrice
house_price_predictors = ['LotArea','YearBuilt','1stFlrSF','2ndFlrSF','FullBath','BedroomAbvGr','TotRmsAbvGrd']
X = data[house_price_predictors]
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
house_model = DecisionTreeRegressor()
house_model.fit(X,y)
from sklearn.metrics import mean_absolute_error
predicted_home_prices = house_model.predict(X)
mean_absolute_error(y, predicted_home_prices)
source.74f73e0f:
import pandas as pd
house_file_path = '../input/train.csv'
data = pd.read_csv(house_file_path)
y = data.SalePrice
house_price_predictors = ['LotArea','YearBuilt','1stFlrSF','2ndFlrSF','FullBath','BedroomAbvGr','TotRmsAbvGrd']
X = data[house_price_predictors]
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
train_X, val_X,train_y, val_y = train_test_split(X,y,random_state=0)
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
house_model = DecisionTreeRegressor()
house_model.fit(train_X,train_y)
from sklearn.metrics import mean_absolute_error
predicted_home_prices = house_model.predict(val_X)
mean_absolute_error(val_y, predicted_home_prices)
source.fd613fe9:
from sklearn.metrics import mean_absolute_error
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
house_file_path = '../input/train.csv'
data = pd.read_csv(house_file_path)
y = data.SalePrice
house_price_predictors = ['LotArea','YearBuilt','1stFlrSF','2ndFlrSF','FullBath','BedroomAbvGr','TotRmsAbvGrd']
X = data[house_price_predictors]
train_X, val_X,train_y, val_y = train_test_split(X,y,random_state=0)
# house_model = DecisionTreeRegressor()
# house_model.fit(train_X,train_y)
# predicted_home_prices = house_model.predict(val_X)
# mean_absolute_error(val_y, predicted_home_prices)

def get_mae(max_leaf_nodes, predictors_train, predictors_val, targ_train, targ_val):
    model = DecisionTreeRegressor(max_leaf_nodes=max_leaf_nodes, random_state=0)
    model.fit(predictors_train, targ_train)
    preds_val = model.predict(predictors_val)
    mae = mean_absolute_error(targ_val, preds_val)
    return(mae)
# compare MAE with differing values of max_leaf_nodes
for max_leaf_nodes in [5, 50, 500, 5000]:
    my_mae = get_mae(max_leaf_nodes, train_X, val_X, train_y, val_y)
    print("Max leaf nodes: %d  \t\t Mean Absolute Error:  %d" %(max_leaf_nodes, my_mae))
source.b77afe9b:
# Introduction
**This will be your workspace for Kaggle's Machine Learning education track.**

You will build and continually improve a model to predict housing prices as you work through each tutorial.  Fork this notebook and write your code in it.

The data from the tutorial, the Melbourne data, is not available in this workspace.  You will need to translate the concepts to work with the data in this notebook, the Iowa data.

Come to the [Learn Discussion](https://www.kaggle.com/learn-forum) forum for any questions or comments. 

# Write Your Code Below
